pros: Almost every team at this organization has an amazing culture of trust and support.
cons: Due to regulatory requirements there is high opportunity for paperwork burnout.

review_title: Look for the Positive in a World full of Negative
pros: Excellent benefits package with options for medical, dental, vision & disability. Generous PTO, EAP and wellness program with $ perks. Modest pay, but make sure you count all of the added benefits in your calculations. Overall a group of really great people with varied interests and a heart for helping others in our community. Depending on your position you may have education benefits or flex time available. For all positions, especially helpful for our entry level positions our EAP provider offers an extensive free library of online learning on a wide variety of topics. We serve a vast population .... headstart & early child, child, adult, elder, disability services, chronic, substance use, residential, emergency services and soon CCBHC. If you want to work in mental health this is the place for you to grow. I look forward to training you! Note: My 5 star experience at CCN may not the norm as I am in a niche IT position in administration. I am also a glass 1/2 full optimist. Find the good. I have always been overworked and stretched thin, but I would also be that way no matter where I worked. I have enjoyed the opportunities that I have been given to grow my skills/career and the flexibility that my position allows.
cons: Like all mental health non-profit agencies the work we do helping people, (many times the same people) never ends. There is always more to do, and not enough staff to do it. Compassionate and empathetic souls will need to set personal boundaries so they are not overwhelmed by this regardless of your position. Staffing nationwide is an issue and one that is felt here as well. Burnout is REAL. Do selfcare!

pros:
Deciding to work here is one of the best career moves I've made. My work supports the efforts of people who absolutely strive to positively impact people's lives and better our community. People who work here are respectful and patient and encourage creative problem-solving. There's a lot of room for innovation here, and I think leadership trusts staff, which is a big deal. 

The benefits here are fantastic, especially considering this is a non-profit, and the employee wellness activities and incentives are fun and just really cool. The ability to work remotely is nice if I need it, though on days when I'm not in the office I find that I miss being around my coworkers and their energy.
cons: This isn't a "con", but more of a "heads up". This is a nonprofit, and nonprofit work is demanding in a different way than for profit work. While CCN is a big organization, staff here do a lot of plate spinning and admin staff especially wear a lot of hats. The to-do lists can get long and overwhelming, and it can be difficult to prioritize things because when your work directly involves the well-being of people, EVERYTHING feels like a priority. And, often, various programs are often scrambling to solve a problem ASAP. It helps to have good expectation management and boundary-setting skills. If you don't, the project pile-on is nonstop and you'll get burnt out very quickly. If you have experience working with non-profits, this will come as no surprise to you. if you dont' have this experience, it can be a bit of an adjustment.

pros: One welcoming and kind front desk employee
cons: Horrible staff and medical care

pros: The DS division just increased their wages for many employees. We also had new leadership come in over the past year and really start listening.

review_title: Loved the work just not the company
job_title: Recovery Support Specialist in Rutland, VT
pros: The work is amazing, one on one with clients, daily emersion, self driven
cons: The company is a mess, they have high turnover and very little organization when it comes to procedures and training

review_title: Work that matters; to folks we serve, to our communities, and to ourselves!
pros: Making genuine connections with  folks we support and empowering them to own their own lives in their own local communities is invigorating! Beyond that, I like being part of a collaborative team, supporting my colleagues and motivating solution-based thinking! Impacting societal change, even just a little bit, rates right up there, too!
cons: Having enough workers, especially Direct Support Professionals, to provide the services people need is an ongoing challenge. And, being part of a large, complex local and state system makes for some challenges but, it is totally worth the effort!

pros: I love the work I do but what makes it even more powerful is observing the hardest workers making a difference in individuals lives that really need it. Working for CCN is very rewarding.
cons: Turnover - it is hard for the Agency to recruit top talent due to restrictions on compensation. This is not because CCN chooses to pay lower; we rely heavily on grants and insurance billing. Unfortunately this limits keeping people in the designated positions.

pros:
•	Paid fairly compared to other non-profits
•	Communicated things that are important in a timely fashion

No stress. Management are so good and friendly. I know well my client. steady pace and its not a busy work place. Plenty of time spend and care for your client.

Best work place and good management I have ever had since I started working as a nurse. Highly recommended for other nurses who want peace, steady and good environment work place.
cons: I honestly don't have any. I really love this company.

pros: Very cohesive work family, new senior leadership team bringing positive change.  The people are incredibly warm and supportive.  Good employee benefits, collaboration with College of St. Joseph offers reduced tuition.
cons: The work is challenging but super rewarding.  It's a non-profit so compensation is less than other employers, but the leadership team is aware and working on solutions.

pros: RMHS/Community Care Network is a consortium of health, human service, employment and rehabilitation programs serving the greater Rutland region.  The company offers competitive salaries, an innovative and supportive work environment and the opportunity to grow while making a difference in the lives of those who need us most.
cons: Haven't found any concerns just yet.

pros: So happy that we have a full team of Senior Management now.  Great people and we're moving in the right direction.  Lots of changes happening every day.
cons: Changes are a little overwhelming sometimes.  Things seem to be happening really fast.

review_title: Mostly positive with hope for the future.
pros: Mostly flexible work schedule. New CEO is good, with all new leadership on board. They are receptive to new ideas so far but haven't seen big changes.
cons: Reeling from a very poor previous CEO, poor EMR design, rift between management and ground level employees. Low compensation. Poor hiring ability.

pros: a-z an excellent employer for anyone seeking a job in this field
cons: I relocated and wish I could have found the same in other jobs
